title.narrative: Emergency Demobilization and Transitional Reintegration Project

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to support the efforts of the Recipient to: (i) demobilize members of the National Liberation Forces and the National Liberation Forces-Dissidents; and (ii) provide socioeconomic reintegration support to said members following demobilization, as well as to Ex-Combatants demobilized under the Emergency Demobilization, Reinsertion, and Reintegration Project, with a particular focus on the provision of such support to such female, child, and disabled Ex-Combatants.

comment.narrative: 09/25/2009 date of project effectiveness

End target value is 100% of the eligible project beneficiaries. Individual demobilization, reinsertion, and reintegrationcomponents have been closed prior to commencement of the additional financing. We continue to report the data, but there are nochanges.

10,112 ex-combatants, including 626 children associated with the armed forces have been demobilized and PNDRR ex-combatants whoonly were entitled to reinsertion benefits. This figure also now includes the expanded caseload of disabled ex-combatants fromPNDRR who have received medical support. Unit of measure for this indicator is Number and therefore, it is reported as a number.
09/25/2009 date of project effectiveness
End target value is 100% of the eligible project beneficiaries
Value is still 0 since none of the project beneficairies have recieved all of their support (i.e. demobilization, reinsertion andreintegration)

title.narrative: Demobilized/released adults and minors out of the total number eligible

comment.narrative: NB: September 25 is the date of project effectiveness. The baseline was 0 in January 2009 and demobilization was in factcompletedby September 2009. This is because demobilization began before effectiveness using a retroactive financing mechanism.
The EPP says that up to a maximum of 6,884 will be demobilized. However, total demobilization numbers will depend on ultimatedemand. Individual component closed.

Demobilization component was closed. We continue to report figures, but there is no new data. Disaggregation, Adults: Male:6091/ Adult Female: 243; Disabled: 170 Previously the number was higher as the 170 disabled were double counted among thedisaggregateadult males. Disaggregation, Minors - Male: 372 / Female: 8 ; FNL: 340 / Dissidents: 40
Individual component closed.
340 FNL minors; 40 minors from the Dissidents

title.narrative: Children that receive appropriate reintegration support as stipulated in the project manual.

comment.narrative: Individual component closed.
620 children of which 339 FNL, 40 FNL-D, 241 PNDRR; and 612 boys and 8 girls

title.narrative: Beneficiaries (Adult) that receive appropriate and timely reintegration support as stipulated in the project manual.

comment.narrative: Individual reintegration component closed.
952 PNDRR, 4,939 FNL, 1,550 dissidents. Among these, 762 Disabled, 6434 male, and 221 female.

title.narrative: Beneficiaries who report greater social acceptance by their communities than during the first three months after demobilization/release

comment.narrative: Final results from 5th and final beneficiary survey.
Based on the preliminary results of the 5th and final beneficiary survey (June 2014).

title.narrative: Beneficiaries who contribute more than 50% to the household income

comment.narrative: Final results from 5th and final beneficiary survey.
Based on the preliminary results of the 5th and final beneficiary survey (June 2014).

title.narrative: Beneficiaries (and/or families, in the case of children) reporting using the majority of reinsertion support to provide for basic needs for themselves and/or dependents.

comment.narrative: Final results from 5th and final beneficiary survey.
Based on the preliminary results of the 5th and final beneficiary survey (June 2014).

title.narrative: Children that receive appropriate (i.e, in kind, to families) and timely reinsertion support as stipulated in the projectmanual.

comment.narrative: 95% of a total estimated caseload of 400. Individual reinsertion component closed.

Represents beneficiaries for whom reinsertion support is complete. 340 FNL, 40 Dissidents, 242 PNDRR. 591 male, 8 female totalidentified (626), but the lower number accounts for less children receiving the third of three reinsertion payments.

title.narrative: Beneficiaries (Adult) that receive timely reinsertion support as stipulated in the project manual

comment.narrative: Individual reinsertion component closed.
Represents beneficiaries for whom reinsertion support is complete. 4,947 FNL, 1,553 FNL-D, 1,556 PNDRR. Of which 7,802 male and245female.
Individual component closed.
Individual component closed.
90% of identified trainees (1500)
Over 100% achieved

title.narrative: Identified disabled ex-combatants who received all foreseen treatment as identified in their medical treatment plan

comment.narrative: 90% of caseload. Actual final caseload number will depend on eventual level of demand.
The current identified caseload is 3,538. The number of ex-combatants who have received medical care is 3303.

title.narrative: Eligible severely disabled ex-combatants who receive a house under the conditions stipulated by the project manual

comment.narrative: The end target is 150 severely disabled ex-combatants to receive a house.
150 ex-combatants and their principle caretaker have received title of a house.

title.narrative: Associations supported by the project that receive transitional economic reintegration support

comment.narrative: 721 associations have received support through the project to date.

title.narrative: Ex-combatants are registered, receive non-transferable ID cards and their data is captured in the MIS

comment.narrative: This component was closed with demobilization in 2009.
Previous data and target erroneously included 380 minors.

title.narrative: Identified minors reunified with family or placed in alternative care arrangements

comment.narrative: All eligible children reunited with their families. This component has been closed.

title.narrative: Conflict affected people to whom benefits have been delivered during the first year of project effectiveness

comment.narrative: This indicator will not change in data as it relates to the number within the first year of the project. Therefore, closed in2010,but will reported until the end of the project.
